ids_info.name: pf_passive
ids_info.description: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description

pf_passive/loop.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: pf_passive/loop
IDS: pf_passive
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 1
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 2
PARENT_CONTAINER: pf_passive
FIELD_NAME: loop
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: pf_passive -> loop

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Passive axisymmetric conductor description in the form of non-connected loops; any connected loops are expressed as active coil circuits with no power supply attached.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[pf_passive]: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description

pf_passive/loop/element/turns_with_sign.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: pf_passive/loop/element/turns_with_sign
IDS: pf_passive
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: pf_passive/loop/element
FIELD_NAME: turns_with_sign
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: pf_passive -> loop -> element -> turns_with_sign

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Number of effective turns in the element for calculating the magnetic field from the coil/loop. Should be positive, unless the coil has elements going in opposite directions. 

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[pf_passive]: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description

CONTAINER[pf_passive/loop/element]: Each loop is comprised of a number of cross-section elements described  individually
CONTAINER[pf_passive/loop/element/geometry]: Cross-sectional shape of the element
CONTAINER[pf_passive/loop/element/geometry/oblique]: Parallelogram description of the element

FIELD_NAME: beta

FULL_PATH: pf_passive/loop/element/geometry/arcs_of_circle
IDS: pf_passive
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 4
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 5
PARENT_CONTAINER: pf_passive/loop/element/geometry
FIELD_NAME: arcs_of_circle
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: pf_passive -> loop -> element -> geometry -> arcs_of_circle

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Description of the element contour by a set of arcs of circle. For each of these, the position of the start point is given together with the curvature radius. The end point is given by the start point of the next arc of circle.

IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: pf_passive -> time

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Generic time

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[pf_passive]: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description
